abstract: Hawtai Motor of Beijing took a 29.9 percent stake in Saab’s parent, Spyker Cars, and lent Saab 30 million euros to restart production.
snippet: Hawtai Motor of Beijing took a 29.9 percent stake in Saab’s parent, Spyker Cars, and lent Saab 30 million euros to restart production.
lead_paragraph: Saab Automobile, the struggling Swedish carmaker, received a lifeline on Tuesday when a Beijing company agreed to provide a loan to help restart production and open access to the booming Chinese market.

headline.main: Saab Gets a Financing Lifeline in Deal With Beijing Carmaker
headline.print_headline: Saab Gets a Financing Lifeline In Deal With Beijing Carmaker
